issue.title: Ensure that new user installation runs smoothly

milestone.title: v1.0.0 Release Ready
milestone.description: The issues that must get closed before release!

issue.body:
1. We should probably have an [onInstalled](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/runtime#event-onInstalled) page pop up like some extensions, with some README-like information on how to use the extension and maybe direct the user to options (KeepTabs doesn't do that much until you've added some hotkeys).
2. We also need to consider how to make the extension work a) immediately upon install and b) after an update. I think the way b) works is the browser auto-updates when the extension isn't running; i.e. in our case when the browser is fully closed. That's okay-ish, although many users probably never fully close Chrome and might instead try manually updating/reloading -- which would break KT functionality until they reload their tabs, as we've always dealt with in development. a) also needs thought, because tabs currently open when the user installs KT will not have the content script, and so won't have KT active on them. I think there's a way to inject the content script into those pages for a seamless experience. Both these items can be explained away in the onInstalled page, but of course it's better to have it be automatic and seamless for the user.

2. We also need to consider how to make the extension work a) immediately upon install and b) after an update. I think the way b) works is the browser auto-updates when the extension isn't running; i.e. in our case when the browser is fully closed. That's okay-ish, although many users probably never fully close Chrome and might instead try manually updating/reloading -- which would break KT functionality until they reload their tabs, as we've always dealt with in development. a) also needs thought, because tabs currently open when the user installs KT will not have the content script, and so won't have KT active on them. I think there's a way to inject the content script into those pages for a seamless experience. Both these items can be explained away in the onInstalled page, but of course it's better to have it be automatic and seamless for the user.

issue.title: Roger
Hotkeys don't work within editing window of a Google Doc
issue.body:
KeepTabs hotkeys don't work when the focus is within the editable part of a Google Docs page (they do if you click outside of it). The console reports this:

> include.preload.js:341 Blocked script execution in 'about:blank' because the document's frame is sandboxed and the 'allow-scripts' permission is not set.

Not sure if we can actually fix this. Putting the key event handlers on window instead of document might work.

issue.title: Hotkeys don't work within editing window of a Google Doc
issue.body:
KeepTabs hotkeys don't work when the focus is within the editable part of a Google Docs page (they do if you click outside of it). The console reports this:

> include.preload.js:341 Blocked script execution in 'about:blank' because the document's frame is sandboxed and the 'allow-scripts' permission is not set.

Not sure if we can actually fix this. Putting the key event handlers on window instead of document might work.

issue.title: UI does not show when focused within the editing window of a Google Doc
issue.body: Unexpectedly, 1f92debb055b8fc567fb6d297292d78f786587ce fixed #2 along with #25. But for some reason, the UI (hold key indicator and tab search) does not show when you activate hold keys while focused within the editing window. As before, everything works normally if you click out of the editing window (e.g. top of the page). Needs investigation to figure out what's going on. I suspect it's more than just CSS because a quick glance at the console suggests that tab search is not being activated at all, not just being hidden under something.

issue.body: Unexpectedly, 1f92debb055b8fc567fb6d297292d78f786587ce fixed #2 along with #25. issue.title: Add "add hotkey for current tab" button in options page
issue.body:
After accidentally wiping all my Chrome data, I had the opportunity to experience what it's like to set up KT as a new user. It wouldn't be as bad if I really was a new user, because I wouldn't have in mind that many hotkeys from the get-go -- as it stands for me, it feels laborious to re-enter all the hotkeys I once had.

Even for the new user, it would be really handy to have a button in the options that adds a new hotkey entry and prefills at least the target and match prefix (maybe default use target as prefix) with the current tab. That would fit really well into the organic process of adding hotkeys as the user goes to each website that they realize would be good to have a hotkey for.

The actual button text needs some thought to make it clear and concise, in conjunction with the existing button (maybe that text should be changed in response too).

issue.title: Within iframes, content script should defer action to the top-level window
issue.body:
A quick, manifest-only change enabled the content script to be injected into iframes, including dynamically generated ones (fixing #25). But it's not a complete solution, because now the UI runs within the iframe, which looks particularly weird with small windows like on hangouts.google.com. The only case where it's a more than cosmetic problem is tab search, where the results can be obscured within a small window. I think it's still rather an edge case, and the work-to-UX-gains ratio is high.

To fix it, we can follow an approach like in https://stackoverflow.com/a/12904047, which is where I started for the solution to #25.

issue.title: Hotkeys aren't captured within iframes

milestone.title: v1.0.0 Release Ready
milestone.description: The issues that must get closed before release!

issue.body:
Hotkeys work on the rest of [the page](http://www.yamli.com/arabic-keyboard/), but not when focused on the editing window. This initially looked like #2, but I don't see the same console messages about sandboxing. There are some messages about scripts being blocked on a slow connection, but I don't see the confirmation message it mentions, I'm not on a slow connection so there's no reason for our content script to be blocked, and I don't see any mention of KeepTabs (it seems related to ads scripts). Logs are attached: 
[www.yamli.com-1491788063736.txt](https://github.com/jchang504/keeptabs/files/908755/www.yamli.com-1491788063736.txt)

issue.title: Overlay CSS selector collides with one on Android Authority webpages

milestone.title: v1.0.0 Release Ready
milestone.description: The issues that must get closed before release!

issue.body: Pages like [this](http://www.androidauthority.com/google-assistant-vs-siri-vs-bixby-vs-amazon-alexa-vs-cortana-best-virtual-assistant-showdown-796205/) happen to use the same CSS selector `#overlay` (not that surprising I guess), rendering our overlay off-screen and useless. We should make this selector (and review others) much more specific, maybe with a prefix like `keeptabs` in order to avoid this and similar bugs in the future.

issue.title: Move CSS to a preprocessor like Sass or Less
issue.body: We don't have a lot of CSS yet, but it's good to do anyway for tidiness. Maybe could even be part of a larger framework use that could eliminate the coupling between CSS and constant selector strings in the JS.

issue.title: Move CSS to a preprocessor like Sass or Less
issue.body: We don't have a lot of CSS yet, but it's good to do anyway for tidiness. Maybe could even be part of a larger framework use that could eliminate the coupling between CSS and constant selector strings in the JS.

issue.title: Move CSS to a preprocessor like Sass or Less
issue.body: We don't have a lot of CSS yet, but it's good to do anyway for tidiness. Maybe could even be part of a larger framework use that could eliminate the coupling between CSS and constant selector strings in the JS.

issue.title: Add "add hotkey for current tab" button in options page
issue.body:
After accidentally wiping all my Chrome data, I had the opportunity to experience what it's like to set up KT as a new user. It wouldn't be as bad if I really was a new user, because I wouldn't have in mind that many hotkeys from the get-go -- as it stands for me, it feels laborious to re-enter all the hotkeys I once had.

Even for the new user, it would be really handy to have a button in the options that adds a new hotkey entry and prefills at least the target and match prefix (maybe default use target as prefix) with the current tab. That would fit really well into the organic process of adding hotkeys as the user goes to each website that they realize would be good to have a hotkey for.

The actual button text needs some thought to make it clear and concise, in conjunction with the existing button (maybe that text should be changed in response too).
